newsitem.title: FRANCE: Frenchman probed for bomb "to teach wife lesson".
newsitem.headline: Frenchman probed for bomb "to teach wife lesson".

text.p: A judge opened a formal investigation on Friday into a Frenchman who confessed to setting off a bomb to "teach his wife a lesson", justice sources said.

They said Thierry Derant, 34, told investigators he set off the crude remote-controlled bomb last Tuesday outside the office of Finalion, a subsidiary of state-owned bank Credit Lyonnais where his wife works, in the central French city of Lyon.
It was not clear why he was angry with his wife and if the unnamed woman was among the six people slightly hurt by the bomb, which was made out of a tin can packed with nails.
Serant was placed under investigation on suspicion of attempted murder and destruction of property with explosives.
